document_data.name: Horomel Ibrin
document_data.titles: Scribe and Speaker of the Merchants
document_data.mainbody: '''Horomel Ibrin''' was a sly negotiator inhabiting [[Tulmon]] along the [[Lake of Steam]] during the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].<ref name=EotSS-p165">
document_data.Description: He was a thin man who always had a disapproving look to his face unless excited by money or wielding his influence.<ref name=EotSS-p165"/>
document_data.Activities: Horomel held the office of "Scribe and Speaker of the Merchants." He served as a link between Tulmon's sultan and the merchant class with all matters related to trade.<ref name=EotSS-p165"/>
document_data.Relationships: He was enemies with [[Orloro Tullamas]] and spent much of his time investigating the merchant with the hopes of catching him breaking the sultan's law.<ref name=EotSS-p166">
